me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.follower

Class GenericFollower

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.follower.GenericFollower
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Follower

    public class GenericFollower
extends java.lang.Object
implements Follower
    A generic implementation of the Follower interface. For almost all use cases, this implementation should work fairly well. This implementation of the Follower interface depends on a "turn controller" - in essence, a Controller that determines the speed at which the robot is turning.
    Since:
    0.0.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericFollower

        public GenericFollower(Trajectory trajectory,
                       Controller turnController)
        Create a new GenericFollower.

        In addition to creating a GenericFollower, this constructor will set the turn controller's target to 0.

        Parameters:
        trajectory - the trajectory the follower should follow.
        turnController - a turn controller, responsible for determining turn values.

      • tick

        public boolean tick(PointXYZ current,
                    java.util.function.Consumer<Translation> consumer)
        Description copied from interface: Follower
        "Tick" the follower once.

        Each time the follower is ticked, a new translation should be generated. The Consumer<Translation> that's supplied to this method will accept that translation, and in doing so, drive the robot accordingly. This translation will always be relative, meaning relative to whatever direction the robot is currently facing.

        Specified by:
        tick in interface Follower
        Parameters:
        current - the robot's current position.
        consumer - a consumer that will accept a generated translation. This translation should never have X or Y values outside the bounds (-1.0, 1.0).
        Returns:
        if the follower has finished, return true, indicating that the follower can be de-queued and the next follower can begin execution. If the follower has not finished, however, return false, indicating that we need to keep going at least a little while longer.
